content:
Sure, here are some more exotic greens that you may have never heard of before:

1. Mâche - Also known as lamb's lettuce, this delicate green has a nutty flavor and can last up to five days when stored in an airtight container in the fridge.

2. Good King Henry - This leafy green has a unique flavor that is similar to spinach and can last up to a week when stored in the fridge.

3. Miner's lettuce - This leafy green has a mild, slightly sour flavor and can last up to five days when stored in an airtight container in the fridge.

4. Amaranth greens - These leafy greens have a slightly peppery, earthy flavor and can last up to five days when stored in the fridge.

5. Red shiso - This Japanese herb has a unique flavor that is both sweet and spicy, and can last up to five days when stored in an airtight container in the fridge.

6. Malabar spinach - This leafy green has a slightly slimy texture and a mild, sweet flavor, and can last up to a week when stored in the fridge.

7. New Zealand spinach - This leafy green has a crispy texture and a mild, slightly salty flavor, and can last up to five days when stored in the fridge.

Again, these recommended times are just rough estimates and depend on factors like the freshness of the produce, storage conditions, and humidity levels.
